alert.note: Alert for Gurabo; Humacao; Juncos; Las Piedras (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 9:45PM ADT until July 09 at 12:15AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Gurabo, Humacao, Juncos and Las Piedras. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Piedras, Juncos, Humacao, Gurabo, Caguas, La Fermina, Anton Ruiz, Celada, Punta Santiago, Pueblito Del Rio, El Mango, Lomas, Bajandas and Candelero Arriba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
